message.content:
cs.IT, cs.SP, cs.LG, cs.SI, cs.NA. 

The paper deals with the problem of predicting a stationary Gaussian process from a window of observations, which is a common problem in communication theory and signal processing. The paper proposes a blind predictor that does not require a priori knowledge of the power spectral density (PSD) of the process, and uses the random spectral representation of the process to obtain a discrete quantization of the underlying random spectrum. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the Information Theory (cs.IT), Signal Processing (cs.SP), and Machine Learning (cs.LG) sub-categories. Additionally, the paper involves numerical optimization techniques, which could place it in the Scientific Computing (cs.SC) or Numerical Analysis (cs.NA) sub-categories. Finally, the blind predictor proposed in the paper could be relevant to the Statistical Learning (cs.SI) sub-category, which deals with methods for learning from data without prior knowledge of the underlying distribution.
